parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID

info.description: Detailed definition of a medicinal product, typically for uses other than direct patient care (e.g. regulatory use)
info.title: FHIR R4 MedicinalProduct Resource

MedicinalProduct.description: Detailed definition of a medicinal product, typically for uses other than direct patient care (e.g. regulatory use)

additionalMonitoringIndicator.description: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons.

attachedDocument.description: Supporting documentation, typically for regulatory submission.

clinicalTrial.description: Clinical trials or studies that this product is involved in.

combinedPharmaceuticalDoseForm.description: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product.

contact.description: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization.

crossReference.description: Reference to another product, e.g. for linking authorised to investigational product.

domain.description: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses.

identifier.description: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

legalStatusOfSupply.description: The legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator.

marketingStatus.description: Marketing status of the medicinal product, in contrast to marketing authorizaton.

masterFile.description: A master file for to the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File).

paediatricUseIndicator.description: If authorised for use in children.

productClassification.description: Allows the product to be classified by various systems.

specialMeasures.description: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

type.description: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized.

confidentialityIndicator.description: To indicate if this proces is commercially confidential

manufacturer.description: The manufacturer or establishment associated with the process

regulator.description: A regulator which oversees the operation

namePart.description: Coding words or phrases of the name

country.description: Country code for where this name applies

jurisdiction.description: Jurisdiction code for where this name applies

part.description: A fragment of a product name

type.description: Idenifying type for this part of the name (e.g. strength part)

date.description: Date when the designation was granted

identifier.description: Identifier for the designation, or procedure number

indication[x].description: Condition for which the medicinal use applies

intendedUse.description: The intended use of the product, e.g. prevention, treatment

species.description: Animal species for which this applies

status.description: For example granted, pending, expired or withdrawn

type.description: The type of special designation, e.g. orphan drug, minor use

MedicinalProductAuthorization.description: The regulatory authorization of a medicinal product

country.description: The country in which the marketing authorization has been granted.

dataExclusivityPeriod.description: A period of time after authorization before generic product applicatiosn can be submitted.

dateOfFirstAuthorization.description: The date when the first authorization was granted by a Medicines Regulatory Agency.

identifier.description: Business identifier for the marketing authorization, as assigned by a regulator.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

internationalBirthDate.description: Date of first marketing authorization for a company's new medicinal product in any country in the World

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

legalBasis.description: The legal framework against which this authorization is granted.

restoreDate.description: The date when a suspended the marketing or the marketing authorization of the product is anticipated to be restored

status.description: The status of the marketing authorization.

statusDate.description: The date at which the given status has become applicable.

subject.description: The medicinal product that is being authorized.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

validityPeriod.description: The beginning of the time period in which the marketing authorization is in the specific status shall be specified A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format

identifier.description: The assigned number for the marketing authorization

legalStatusOfSupply.description: The legal status of supply in a jurisdiction or region

validityPeriod.description: The start and expected end date of the authorization

application.description: Applcations submitted to obtain a marketing authorization

disease.description: The disease, symptom or procedure for the contraindication.

diseaseStatus.description: The status of the disease or symptom for the contraindication.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

population.description: The population group to which this applies.

subject.description: The medication for which this is an indication.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

therapeuticIndication.description: Information about the use of the medicinal product in relation to other therapies as part of the indication

medication[x].description: Reference to a specific medication (active substance, medicinal product or class of products) as part of an indication or contraindication

therapyRelationshipType.description: The type of relationship between the medicinal product indication or contraindication and another therapy

comorbidity.description: Comorbidity (concurrent condition) or co-infection as part of the indication.

diseaseStatus.description: The status of the disease or symptom for which the indication applies.

diseaseSymptomProcedure.description: The disease, symptom or procedure that is the indication for treatment.

duration.description: Timing or duration information as part of the indication.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

intendedEffect.description: The intended effect, aim or strategy to be achieved by the indication.

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

population.description: The population group to which this applies.

subject.description: The medication for which this is an indication.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

undesirableEffect.description: Describe the undesirable effects of the medicinal product.

medication[x].description: Reference to a specific medication (active substance, medicinal product or class of products) as part of an indication or contraindication

therapyRelationshipType.description: The type of relationship between the medicinal product indication or contraindication and another therapy

MedicinalProductIngredient.description: An ingredient of a manufactured item or pharmaceutical product

allergenicIndicator.description: If the ingredient is a known or suspected allergen.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

role.description: Ingredient role e.g. Active ingredient, excipient.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

confidentiality.description: Confidentiality level of the specified substance as the ingredient

group.description: The group of specified substance, e.g. group 1 to 4

strength.description: Quantity of the substance or specified substance present in the manufactured item or pharmaceutical product

concentration.description: The strength per unitary volume (or mass)

concentrationLowLimit.description: A lower limit for the strength per unitary volume (or mass), for when there is a range. The concentration attribute then becomes the upper limit

country.description: The country or countries for which the strength range applies

measurementPoint.description: For when strength is measured at a particular point or distance

presentation.description: The quantity of substance in the unit of presentation, or in the volume (or mass) of the single pharmaceutical product or manufactured item

presentationLowLimit.description: A lower limit for the quantity of substance in the unit of presentation. For use when there is a range of strengths, this is the lower limit, with the presentation attribute becoming the upper limit

referenceStrength.description: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance

country.description: The country or countries for which the strength range applies

measurementPoint.description: For when strength is measured at a particular point or distance

strength.description: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance

strengthLowLimit.description: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance

strength.description: Quantity of the substance or specified substance present in the manufactured item or pharmaceutical product

effect.description: The effect of the interaction, for example "reduced gastric absorption of primary medication".

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

incidence.description: The incidence of the interaction, e.g. theoretical, observed.

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

subject.description: The medication for which this is a described interaction.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

type.description: The type of the interaction e.g. drug-drug interaction, drug-food interaction, drug-lab test interaction

item[x].description: The specific medication, food or laboratory test that interacts

MedicinalProductManufactured.description: The manufactured item as contained in the packaged medicinal product

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

manufacturedDoseForm.description: Dose form as manufactured and before any transformation into the pharmaceutical product.

manufacturer.description: Manufacturer of the item (Note that this should be named "manufacturer" but it currently causes technical issues)

quantity.description: The quantity or "count number" of the manufactured item.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

unitOfPresentation.description: The “real world” units in which the quantity of the manufactured item is described.

MedicinalProductPackaged.description: A medicinal product in a container or package

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

legalStatusOfSupply.description: The legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator.

subject.description: The product with this is a pack for.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

immediatePackaging.description: A number appearing on the immediate packaging (and not the outer packaging)

outerPackaging.description: A number appearing on the outer packaging of a specific batch

alternateMaterial.description: A possible alternate material for the packaging

device.description: A device accompanying a medicinal product

manufacturedItem.description: The manufactured item as contained in the packaged medicinal product

material.description: Material type of the package item

quantity.description: The quantity of this package in the medicinal product, at the current level of packaging. The outermost is always 1

type.description: The physical type of the container of the medicine

MedicinalProductPharmaceutical.description: A pharmaceutical product described in terms of its composition and dose form

administrableDoseForm.description: The administrable dose form, after necessary reconstitution.

identifier.description: An identifier for the pharmaceutical medicinal product.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

status.description: The status of characteristic e.g. assigned or pending

firstDose.description: The first dose (dose quantity) administered in humans can be specified, for a product under investigation, using a numerical value and its unit of measurement

maxDosePerDay.description: The maximum dose per day (maximum dose quantity to be administered in any one 24-h period) that can be administered as per the protocol referenced in the clinical trial authorisation

maxDosePerTreatmentPeriod.description: The maximum dose per treatment period that can be administered as per the protocol referenced in the clinical trial authorisation

maxSingleDose.description: The maximum single dose that can be administered as per the protocol of a clinical trial can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement

maxTreatmentPeriod.description: The maximum treatment period during which an Investigational Medicinal Product can be administered as per the protocol referenced in the clinical trial authorisation

targetSpecies.description: A species for which this route applies

withdrawalPeriod.description: A species specific time during which consumption of animal product is not appropriate

supportingInformation.description: Extra information about the withdrawal period

tissue.description: Coded expression for the type of tissue for which the withdrawal period applues, e.g. meat, milk

frequencyOfOccurrence.description: The frequency of occurrence of the effect.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

population.description: The population group to which this applies.

subject.description: The medication for which this is an indication.

symptomConditionEffect.description: The symptom, condition or undesirable effect.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

text.description: Plain text representation of the concept

display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

identifier.description: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known

reference.description: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

period.description: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

system.description: The namespace for the identifier value

code.description: Symbol in syntax defined by the system

display.description: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

system.description: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

userSelected.description: If this coding was chosen directly by the user

version.description: Version of the system - if relevant

url.description: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

country.description: The country in which the marketing authorisation has been granted shall be specified It should be specified using the ISO 3166 ‑ 1 alpha-2 code elements

dateRange.description: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE “Placed on the market” refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain

jurisdiction.description: Where a Medicines Regulatory Agency has granted a marketing authorisation for which specific provisions within a jurisdiction apply, the jurisdiction can be specified using an appropriate controlled terminology The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified

restoreDate.description: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorisation Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE “Placed on the market” refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain

status.description: This attribute provides information on the status of the marketing of the medicinal product See ISO/TS 20443 for more information and examples

lastUpdated.description: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.

profile.description: Profiles this resource claims to conform to

security.description: Security Labels applied to this resource

source.description: Identifies where the resource comes from

div.description: The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.

end.description: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.
